title: How to Make Chicken Broccoli Bake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 190°C, Gas 5 or 375°F.
Put the chicken breasts inside a saucepan filled with water and butter.
steps.description: Bring them to the boil. Simmer for 20 minutes until they're cooked. Allow the chicken to cool in the water. When cooled, drain them and chop the breasts into bite-sized pieces. Unlike above, traditionally they are not spiced, but season the chicken however you'd like! If you're under time pressure, you can also use left over chicken or fry it instead. However, the results are a lot better if you cook the chicken in water, as they'll become very succulent and moist.

steps.headline: Place the frozen broccoli in a pan of boiling water to par cook.
steps.description: Continue the cooking process for 4 minutes. Remove and drain, then place it in ice cold water to stop the cooking process instantly. Set it aside.

steps.headline: Insert the chicken and broccoli inside the ovenproof dish.
steps.description: If you don't have an ovenproof container, use origami tin foil or parchment paper instead. Never use plastic because it'll melt during the process.

steps.headline: Mix the mayonnaise, curry powder and soup inside a different bowl.
steps.description: Pour the mixture over the chicken and broccoli.

steps.headline: Mix the cheese, melted butter and breadcrumbs together.
steps.description: Sprinkle it over the broccoli and chicken inside the dish.

steps.headline: Bake inside the oven for 20-25 minutes until piping hot and golden.

text: Preheat the oven to 190°C, Gas 5 or 375°F.  Put the chicken breasts inside a saucepan filled with water and butter. Bring them to the boil. Simmer for 20 minutes until they're cooked. Allow the chicken to cool in the water. When cooled, drain them and chop the breasts into bite-sized pieces. Unlike above, traditionally they are not spiced, but season the chicken however you'd like! If you're under time pressure, you can also use left over chicken or fry it instead. However, the results are a lot better if you cook the chicken in water, as they'll become very succulent and moist. Place the frozen broccoli in a pan of boiling water to par cook. Continue the cooking process for 4 minutes. Remove and drain, then place it in ice cold water to stop the cooking process instantly. Set it aside. Insert the chicken and broccoli inside the ovenproof dish. If you don't have an ovenproof container, use origami tin foil or parchment paper instead. Never use plastic because it'll melt during the process. Mix the mayonnaise, curry powder and soup inside a different bowl. Pour the mixture over the chicken and broccoli. Mix the cheese, melted butter and breadcrumbs together. Sprinkle it over the broccoli and chicken inside the dish. Bake inside the oven for 20-25 minutes until piping hot and golden. Take the dish out of the oven once time has come. Enjoy your meal! Serve with vegetables or salad.
